instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light, it's ticking.
threads.message:
So this board came in that is ticking very softly.
When I use a knock off charger the green light flashes really quickly. OEM doesn't light up.

I tried the mechanics trick and used a small pipe to try work out where the ticking is coming from but it didn't work in this case. Board must be too dense or something.

Any ideas where could be ticking and how I can break the circuit to see?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light, it's ticking.
threads.message: Hi i have olso have that tik tik tik tik sound realy soft when charger is plug on i got green light and low ppbus

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light, it's ticking.
threads.message: Short on PPBUS? 3V42 stable? Check <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> area and <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR>/85.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light, it's ticking.
threads.message:
I'm not picking up on a shorted PPBUS. It measures 0.430 in diode mode but is only about 0.5v

PPBus is a flat 0v.

Investigating <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR>/5 now. ISL measures okay itself.
